channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Hugo Aguilar Ortiz Became Mexico’s Most Powerful Indigenous Lawyer
item.description: Hugo Aguilar Ortiz grew up in a remote Mixtec-speaking village. He is now one of the most powerful lawyers in Mexico.

item.title: As Black New Yorkers Move Out, N.Y.C. Politics May Be Reshaped
item.description: Housing affordability and quality-of-life concerns are pushing longtime Black New Yorkers out of the city, underscoring Democrats’ challenges with the...

item.title: Supreme Court to Hear Rastafarian Prisoner’s Suit Over Shaved Dreadlocks
item.description: Damon Landor, whose faith requires him to let his hair grow long, said guards threw a court ruling in the trash before holding him down and shaving hi...

item.title: Iran launches missile attack on U.S. base in Qatar as Tehran responds to attack on nuclear sites
item.description: Iran announced on state television that it attacked American forces stationed at Qatar’s Al Udeid Air Base.

item.title: Trump demands ‘everyone’ keep oil prices down after Iran threatens to close Strait of Hormuz following U.S. attack: ‘I’m watching’
item.description: Trump urged stepped-up production as the White House sharpened its warnings to Iran against closing the Strait of Hormuz.

item.title: Vera Rubin Telescope Quickly Found 1,200 New Asteroids
item.description: The Vera C. Rubin Observatory is expected to find millions of unknown objects in our solar system, and perhaps even a mysterious Planet Nine.

item.title: U.K. to Ban Palestine Action Group as Terrorist Organization
item.description: The British government announced plans to proscribe Palestine Action after members broke into a military air base.

item.title: The Strait of Hormuz is a critical chokepoint for global energy markets, but there are ways to get around it
item.description: About 20 million barrels of oil a day flow through the Strait of Hormuz, or the equivalent of 20% of global petroleum liquids consumption.

item.title: Anthony Pompliano strikes deal to create publicly-traded Bitcoin treasury company
item.description: The company will spend up to $1 billion to establish a Bitcoin treasury.

item.title: HSBC’s return-to-office push risks denting CEO’s savings plan
item.description: The extra real estate costs could hinder the bank in its bid to find $1.5 billion in annual cost savings.

item.title: How Hugo Aguilar Ortiz Became Mexico’s Most Powerful Indigenous Lawyer
item.description: Hugo Aguilar Ortiz grew up in a remote Mixtec-speaking village. He is now one of the most powerful lawyers in Mexico.

item.title: Claims of Potential Human Rights Violations Strain E.U.-Israeli Relations
item.description: A review by the bloc found Israel’s actions in Gaza may have breached obligations under a treaty that governs their relations. Israel called the repor...

item.title: Photos: A Road Trip Through Syria After the Fall of Bashar al-Assad
item.description: After decades of dictatorship and 13 years of civil war, can Syria put itself back together? Our journalists traveled the length of the country to exp...

item.title: What to Know About Iran’s Notorious Evin Prison
item.description: Israel’s military struck entrances to the detention facility in Tehran, where dissidents and political prisoners are held. Human rights groups say the...

item.title: Live Updates: Iran Fires Missiles at U.S. Base in Qatar
item.description: The target was Al Udeid Air Base, the largest American military installation in the Middle East. Qatar said its air defenses had intercepted the missi...
